DataElement.preferredName: Central Nervous System Disease or Disorder Response Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent._the date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Central Nervous System Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The main information-processing organs of the nervous system, consisting of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Response is any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
